keyMoments.title: Zoro vs. Ohm Battle Continues
keyMoments.description: Zoro continues his intense battle against Priest Ohm, facing the deadly Ordeal of Iron with its 0% survival rate.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's growth and ability to overcome opponents with advanced observation abilities.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Debuts 108 Pound Cannon
keyMoments.description: Zoro unleashes his new technique, the 108 Pound Cannon (Hyaku Hachi Pound Ho), a powerful evolution of his previous flying slash attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a significant milestone in Zoro's development as a swordsman and becomes one of his signature techniques.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Defeats Ohm
keyMoments.description: Using his 108 Pound Cannon technique, Zoro successfully defeats Priest Ohm, becoming the first person to survive the Ordeal of Iron.
keyMoments.significance: Proves Zoro's growth and eliminates one of Enel's four priests.

abilities.abilityName: Hyaku Hachi Pound Ho (108 Pound Cannon)
abilities.description: A powerful three-sword style flying slash attack that is an evolution of the 36 and 72 Pound Cannon techniques.

keyMoments.title: Ohm's Iron Cloud Techniques
keyMoments.description: Ohm demonstrates his full arsenal of Iron Cloud techniques including Eisen Whip, Eisen Back, Eisen Fan, Eisen Fork, and Eisen Fleuret.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the full extent of Ohm's combat capabilities and the versatility of his Iron Cloud weapon system.
keyMoments.quote: My Iron Cloud can take any shape I desire!

keyMoments.title: Ohm Defeated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Ohm is defeated by Zoro's 108 Pound Cannon technique, marking the end of the Ordeal of Iron.
keyMoments.significance: One of Enel's four priests is eliminated, weakening Enel's forces.

abilities.description: Advanced observation abilities that allow Ohm to predict opponent movements and strike from great distances.
A powerful whip-like attack using the Iron Cloud sword.
Forms a solid wall of Iron Cloud to block attacks.
Shapes the blade into a fan-like weapon for striking.
Shapes the sword into a giant fork and wields it like a whip.
Shapes the sword into a long, sharp spear and projects it at opponents.

keyMoments.title: Learns of Enel's Plan
keyMoments.description: Pagaya hears from an injured royal guard that Enel plans to destroy all of Skypiea and escape to Fairy Vearth.
keyMoments.significance: The truth about Enel's genocidal intentions is revealed to civilians.

keyMoments.title: Pagaya's Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: Pagaya pushes Conis out of the way and takes the full force of Enel's lightning attack to protect his daughter.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Pagaya's love for his daughter and the personal cost of Enel's tyranny.

relationships.description: Pagaya is Conis's father and protects her from Enel's lightning attack.

evolutionMoments.description: Pagaya sacrifices himself to save Conis from Enel's lightning.

keyMoments.title: Learns of Enel's Plan
keyMoments.description: Conis learns from an injured royal guard that Enel plans to destroy all of Skypiea and its inhabitants.
keyMoments.significance: Understanding the full scope of Enel's evil motivates Conis and reveals the stakes of the conflict.

keyMoments.title: Saved by Pagaya
keyMoments.description: Conis is pushed to safety by her father Pagaya as Enel attacks them with lightning.
keyMoments.significance: Conis is saved by her father's sacrifice.

evolutionMoments.description: Conis witnesses her father sacrifice himself to save her from Enel.

keyMoments.title: Enel's Genocidal Plan Revealed
keyMoments.description: Enel's plan to destroy all of Skypiea and escape to Fairy Vearth (the moon) using the Ark Maxim is revealed to Pagaya and Conis.
keyMoments.significance: Exposes the true scope of Enel's tyranny and his view that people in the sky are unnatural.

keyMoments.title: Enel Attacks Pagaya
keyMoments.description: Enel strikes Pagaya and Conis with lightning after they learn of his plan.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Enel's ruthlessness and willingness to kill anyone who knows too much.

reveals.information: Plans to destroy all of Skypiea and escape to Fairy Vearth (the moon) using the Ark Maxim

keyMoments.title: Wyper Attempts to Rescue Aisa
keyMoments.description: Wyper fires his Burn Bazooka at the giant snake Nola trying to rescue Aisa who was swallowed.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Wyper's protective nature toward the Shandia people, especially the children.
